user-email.label: Email
user-email.hint: Use your work address so we can confirm who you work for

fr-location.legend: Where are you making this report?

yes.label: Yes
yes.toggle-content: They will be treated as a child during the process.

no.label: No
no.toggle-content: They will be treated as an adult during the process.

not-sure.label: Not Sure
not-sure.toggle-content: If you’re not sure of the potential victim’s age, you will need to refer them to the relevant local authority for an age assessment. They will continue to be treated as a child until a decision on their age is made.

pv-under-age-at-time-of-exploitation.legend: Were they under 18 at any time during the exploitation?

what-happened.label: Provide as much detail as you can. Do not include their name or the names of any other potential victims.
what-happened.paragraph-1: A detailed report should include information about:
what-happened.bullet-1: how the potential victim was treated
what-happened.bullet-2: what an average day was like and a description of their living conditions
what-happened.paragraph-2: If they were trafficked, it helps to know:
what-happened.bullet-3: where they were recruited and who arranged the journey
what-happened.bullet-4: details of their journey, including if they travelled with anyone

where-exploitation-happened-other-uk-oth.label: Address or location
where-exploitation-happened-other-uk-oth.hint: Provide any addresses, locations or other details that may help us identify the location of the exploitation(s).

where-exploitation-happened-other-overse.label: Address or location
where-exploitation-happened-other-overse.hint: Provide any addresses, locations or other details that may help us identify the location of the exploitation(s).

who-exploited-pv.label: Details about the exploiter(s)
who-exploited-pv.hint: Include the languages the exploiters spoke, their gang or nicknames and if they had identifying features such as tattoos.

types-of-exploitation-forced-to-work.label: Forced to work for nothing or almost nothing
types-of-exploitation-forced-to-work.hint: Victims may live in isolated areas or poor conditions, such as in squats or at their place of work. They may be unable to leave and threatened with violence.

types-of-exploitation-wages-taken.label: Wages taken by force or coercion, such as through control of a bank account

types-of-exploitation-forced-to-commit-f.label: Forced to commit fraud, such as using their identity to claim benefits

types-of-exploitation-taken-somewhere.label: Taken somewhere, held against their will and sexually assaulted

types-of-exploitation-forced-to-commit-c.label: Forced to commit a crime, such as growing cannabis, drug dealing or begging
types-of-exploitation-forced-to-commit-c.hint: This includes being used as a drug mule across county lines. Victims will often be unpaid although they may get food and somewhere to live.

types-of-exploitation-organs-removed.label: Organs, such as kidneys, removed against their will

types-of-exploitation-unpaid-household-w.label: Forced to do unpaid household work by relatives or strangers
types-of-exploitation-unpaid-household-w.hint: Victims who are exploited by relatives may have been forced into an arranged marriage and abused in other ways.

any-other-pvs.legend: Were there any other potential victims?

reported-to-police.legend: Do they have a crime reference number?

reported-to-police-crime-reference.label: Enter crime or incident reference number (if given one)

pv-want-to-submit-nrm.legend: Do they have a crime reference number?
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.paragraph-1: If a potential victim wants you to refer their case, they can get:
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.bullet-1: access to support (for example, housing and legal advice)
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.bullet-2: a formal decision – this can help if they’re being prosecuted for a crime they were forced to commit
pv-want-to-submit-nrm.div-1: We will need to share their personal details with organisations such as the police and the Home Office if they refer their case.

yes.label: Yes – I have explained this to the potential victim and they want me to refer their case

no.label: No – I have explained this to the potential victim and they do not want me to refer their case
no.hint: They understand this means their case will not be referred to the NRM and they will not receive support or a formal decision.

refuse-nrm.label: Why don’t they want thier case referred? (Optional)

refuse-nrm-co-operate-with-police.legend: Can the police contact them about their case?

refuse-nrm-pv-name-nickname.label: Nickname or name used during exploitation

refuse-nrm-pv-contact-details.legend: How should we notify them of our decision?
refuse-nrm-pv-contact-details.hint: Select all that apply. If they don’t have an email or postal address, enter the details of the support provider.

refuse-nrm-pv-contact-details-email-chec.label: It is safe to write to them here

refuse-nrm-pv-contact-details-post-check.label: It is safe to write to them here

pv-name-that-requires-support-nickname.label: Nickname or name used during exploitation

pv-dob.hint: For example, 31 3 1980. Fill in what you know.

unknown.label: They do not identify as male or female

pv-nationality-second.label: Select second nationality
pv-nationality-second.summary-text: Select a second nationality for dual nationals

pv-other-help-with-communication.hint: For example, a hearing aid or a sign language interpreter.

pv-ho-reference.legend: Do they have any Home Office references?
pv-ho-reference.hint: For example, a Home Office visa application or port reference

pv-ho-reference-type.label: Enter type of reference, reference number or both (if known)

pv-contact-details.legend: How should we notify them of our decision?
pv-contact-details.hint: Select all that apply. If they don’t have an email or postal address, enter the details of the support provider.

pv-contact-details-email-check.label: It is safe to write to them here

pv-contact-details-post-check.label: It is safe to write to them here

pv-phone-number.legend: Can the support provider contact them by phone?

co-operate-with-police.legend: Can the police contact them about their case?

supporting-documents-add.legend: Do you want to upload supporting documents?

supporting-documents-add-another.legend: Do you want to upload any additional documents to support your application?

fr-alternative-contact.label: Email address
fr-alternative-contact.hint: This could be a manager, colleague or a team inbox.
